title: Meet the BBC’s 'undercover voters' for the US midterms
description: An investigation into what US voters see on social media in the run-up to the midterm elections.

title: Wildlife photographer of the year: Is this ape really cuddling a pet mongoose?
description: Mystery and wonder in this year's shortlisted images for Wildlife Photographer of the Year.

title: MOTD analysis: How Harvey Elliott 'shone' for Liverpool against Newcastle
description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy believes his former club Liverpool could save "a few quid in the market" thanks to the form of 19-year-old winger Harvey Elliott, who "shone" in Wednesday's 2-1 Premier League win over Newcastle.

title: Let's talk: 'Therapy is not weak or unnecessary'
description: Living through a global pandemic boosted demand for therapy as people sought help with their mental health.

title: Hunstanton seafront water fountain vandalised with washing up liquid
description: A seafront water feature, whose fish have always been donated by the public, falls victim to vandals.

title: Child assaults: ‘If the police won’t do their job, we’ll do it for them’
description: Mums - whose children have been attacked by teenagers - are on patrol saying police are not doing enough.

title: Chris Dawson: How The Teacher's Pet podcast helped catch and jail a killer
description: Forty years after Lynette Dawson went missing, an Australian court jailed her husband for murder.

title: Queen to appoint new prime minister at Balmoral
description: In a break with tradition, the next PM will travel to Scotland for the appointment on 6 September.

title: When Gorbachev helped sell American pizza
description: In 1998, Pizza Hut released an advert featuring Mikhail Gorbachev which was ridiculed by Russian press.

title: England v South Africa: Hosts name unchanged squad for deciding Test at The Oval
description: England name an unchanged 14-man squad for the third and deciding Test against South Africa at The Oval next month.

title: Giant hailstone: Toddler killed in violent Spanish storm
description: Around 50 people are injured by hailstones that measured up to 10cm in diameter.

title: Royal Mail and BT strikes see 150,000 workers walk out
description: Thousands of postal and telecoms staff are on strike and further action is planned for September.

title: Quiet quitting: The workplace trend taking over TikTok
description: Workers are starting to "quiet quit" in a bid to get their work-life balance back.

title: Popstar Madison Beer on the downsides of social media fame
description: The popstar was 13 when she shot to fame after Justin Bieber tweeted a video of her singing.

title: Boris Johnson resignation: Did the outgoing prime minister meet his pledges?
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson made promises on Brexit,, taxes, health and police - did he deliver on them?

title: Nord Stream 1: Russia shuts major gas pipeline to Europe
description: European countries dismiss claims the pipeline needs repairs, saying the move is linked to Ukraine.

title: Fishermen begin legal campaign over dead shellfish
description: The fisherman fear the deaths were linked to the release of a chemical as a result of dredging.

title: Charlbi Dean: Tributes to film and TV 'star-in-the-making' after death at 32
description: There is shock at the death of a "true star-in-the-making" who was "on the verge of a breakthrough".

title: In pictures: The life of ex-Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev
description: The ex-Soviet leader - who was one of the 20th century's most influential figures - dies age 91.

title: Mikhail Gorbachev: Last Soviet leader dies aged 91
description: The former president opened up the Soviet Union but failed to prevent its collapse in 1991.

title: Rishi Sunak: Former chancellor bidding for top job
description: A former finance analyst, Rishi Sunak's leadership bid has focused on his handling of the economy.

title: Arcade Fire start world tour in Dublin after Win Butler abuse allegations
description: The band begin a world tour in Dublin days after frontman Win Butler was accused of sexual misconduct.

title: Who is Liz Truss? Profile of would-be PM
description: A profile of Liz Truss, who is bidding to replace Boris Johnson as Tory leader and prime minister.

title: Remembering a warm-hearted man
description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg recalls his meetings with the late Mikhail Gorbachev over the past 20 years.

title: Documents likely concealed at Donald Trump's Florida home - officials
description: The FBI is investigating whether the former president improperly handled classified records.

title: Pakistan floods: Images show extent of devastation
description: Satellite images and graphics reveal the scale of floods that have left millions homeless in Pakistan.

title: Hornsea 2: North Sea wind farm claims title of world's largest
description: The world's largest offshore wind farm is now fully operational, 55 miles off the coast of Yorkshire.

title: FA Cup: Former Liverpool academy player Dahrius Waldron on prison and rejection
description: Dahrius Waldron went from sharing a pitch with Steven Gerrard to prison, and will play in FA Cup qualifying this weekend.

title: Switzerland's vanishing glaciers threaten Europe's water supply
description: Ice in the Swiss Alps provides water for rivers, crops and the cooling of nuclear power stations.

title: World Cup 2022: Completing Panini sticker book could cost £883
description: An expert says fans might have to shell out nearly £900 to fill the popular album - but do they have to?

title: Tory leadership: Pressure on Liz Truss over bill help ahead of final hustings
description: As the Tory race reaches its climax, uncertainty still surrounds the frontrunner's cost of living plans.

title: Rationing energy is nothing new for off-grid community
description: Scoraig in the north west Highlands has long had to make careful use of its electricity supply.

title: US Open: Emma Raducanu targets clean slate after New York exit
description: British teenager Emma Raducanu says she is looking forward to starting with a "clean slate" after an early end to her US Open title defence.
